Craig Groeschel was born in 1967 in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. He grew up in a Christian home and was raised in the Church of Christ. input: Write a short biography of Jane Goodall.
output:
Jane Goodall is a British primatologist and anthropologist. She is best known for her research on chimpanzees in Tanzania.

## Early life

Jane Goodall was born in London, England on April 3, 1934. She was the youngest of three children. Her father was a World War I veteran and her mother was a secretary.

## Education

Goodall attended Birkbeck College in London. She received a B.A. in 1957 and a Ph.D. in 1965.

## Career

Goodall is best known for her research on chimpanzees in Tanzania. She is the founder of the Jane Goodall Institute and the Roots & Shoots program.

## Awards

* 1971: National Book Award for General Nonfiction for In the Shadow of Man
* 1972: Gold Medal from the Royal Zoological Society of Scotland
* 1975: Gold Medal from the Linnean Society of London

Wangari Maathai was a Kenyan environmentalist and politician. She was the first African woman to receive the Nobel Peace Prize.

Wangari Maathai was born in 1940 in Nyeri, Kenya. She was the daughter of a farmer and a schoolteacher. She was the second of eight children.

## Education

Maathai attended St. Anthony Girls High School in Nyeri, Kenya. She then attended Mount St. Scholastica College in Atchison, Kansas, United States. She then received a Ph.D. in biology from the University of Nairobi in 1971.

He died in 1910.
